abstract: Why do Wall Street bankers, traders and executives get paid so much money for doing jobs that rarely require them to innovate, enlighten or put their own capital at risk, William D. Cohan asks in Opinionator.
snippet: Why do Wall Street bankers, traders and executives get paid so much money for doing jobs that rarely require them to innovate, enlighten or put their own capital at risk, William D. Cohan asks in Opinionator.
lead_paragraph: From Willaim D. Cohan at Opinionator:

headline.main: Cohan: On Wall Street, All Reward, No Risk
